terminal.translation[0].definitions[0].d: a big building where people wait to get onto planes, buses, or ships, or where goods are loaded
terminal.translation[0].definitions[1].d: a piece of computer equipment consisting of at least a keyboard and a screen, that you use for putting in or taking out information from a large computer
terminal.translation[0].definitions[2].d: one of the points at which you can connect wires in an electrical circuit
terminal.translation[1].definitions[0].d: a terminal illness cannot be cured, and causes death
terminal.translation[2].definitions[0].d: a large building that is part of an airport, bus station, or port, where people wait to get onto planes, buses, or ships
terminal.translation[2].definitions[1].d: a piece of computer equipment that consists of a keyboard and a screen, used as part of a network of computers that are all connected to each other or to one large computer
terminal.translation[2].definitions[1].e: A PC can work as a terminal on a network.
